title: Partial US Government Shutdown Begins as House Delays Funding Vote
snippets: Because the House still needs to vote Monday, a partial government shutdown was set to happen over the weekend.

summary: A partial US government shutdown began on Saturday after the House of Representatives failed to vote on a funding deal. The Senate passed a measure to avert the shutdown, but the House is in recess until Monday, when a vote could reopen the government. The funding impasse centers on Democratic opposition to Department of Homeland Security spending following recent enforcement actions.
